page.title: 10OWERMOIGNE'S FEATURES (2)
page.content: { { { {WEST FARM,}NOW A PRIVATE HOUSE,DATES FROM THE 18TH CENTURY.THE LINES OF AN EXTERIOR STAIRCASE AND AN OLD PAY WINDOW CAN STILL BE SEEN.IN ITS LIVING ROOM IT HAS AN INGLENOOK FIREPLACE WITH BREAD OVEN.{WEST DAIRY FARM (NOW} {MOYNE COTTAGE)}IS A THATCHED GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDING.{HARTNELL FARM}IS NOW HALF PRIVATE AND HALF A SMALL HOLDING. IT WAS THE SITE OF THE VILLAGE CARPENTER'S SHOP.THE{SCHOOL}WAS BUILT BY REV. J. CREE IN 1873 BEFORE WHICH THE CHILDREN WERE TAUGHT IN THE RECTORY STABLES.THE{OLD FORGE}IS NOW A PRIVATE HOUSE AND THE{MEDIEVAL MILL}IS A NURSERY WITH A CIDER PRESS.THE {VILLAGE SPRING}WAS THE LOCAL WATER SOURCE FOR GENERATIONS AND THE{STREAM} STILL FLOWS THROUGH THE VILLAGE.
